    • writeVmTotal

      public void writeVmTotal(int vmIdNum)
      Used for reading the total IDs from a file.
      Parameters:
      vmIdNum -

    • readVmIdTotal

      public int readVmIdTotal()
      Reads the total number of existing vending machines from the vmList file and returns the next available vending machine ID. If the vmList file does not exist, a new file is created, and the vmID is initialized to 1. Subsequently, the method returns 1 as the next available vending machine ID. If the vmList file exists, the current value of the vmID is read from the file, and the method returns the next available vending machine ID by incrementing the current value by 1.
      Returns:
      The next available vending machine ID as an integer.

    • writeBuyerInfo

      public void writeBuyerInfo(String name, int id, String type, int slots)
      Writes the buyer information to the vmList file in append mode. The method takes the buyer's name, ID, type, and the number of slots as input parameters and writes this information as a new line in the vmList file, separated by underscores (_). The file is opened in append mode to add the new buyer information at the end of the file.
      Parameters:
      name - The buyer's name to be written to the file.
      id - The buyer's ID to be written to the file.
      type - The buyer's type (regular or special) to be written to the file.
      slots - The number of slots purchased by the buyer to be written to the file.

    • searchVmId

      public boolean searchVmId(String vmID)
      Searches for a vending machine ID in the vmList file. The method takes a vending machine ID as a string input and searches for it in the vmList file. It uses a Scanner to read each line of the file and extract the ID from each line. If the provided vending machine ID is found in the file, the method returns true. Otherwise, it returns false.
      Parameters:
      vmID - The vending machine ID to be searched for in the vmList file.
      Returns:
      true if the vending machine ID is found in the file, false otherwise.

    • addItems

      public void addItems(int vmID, String vmName, int slotNum, String type, String itemName, double price, double calories, String weight, int qty, boolean isSold, boolean isIngredient, String desc)
      Adds items to the itemList file associated with the given vending machine. The method takes various parameters representing item information and adds them as a new line in the itemList file associated with the provided vending machine ID and name. The itemList file is created if it does not exist. The method uses a BufferedWriter to open the file in append mode and write the new item information to it.
      Parameters:
      vmID - The ID of the vending machine to which the item belongs.
      vmName - The name of the vending machine to which the item belongs.
      slotNum - The slot number of the vending machine where the item will be stored.
      type - The type of the item (e.g., regular or special).
      itemName - The name of the item.
      price - The price of the item.
      calories - The calorie content of the item.
      weight - The weight of the item.
      qty - The quantity of the item available in the vending machine.
      isSold - A boolean indicating if the item is for sale or not.
      isIngredient - A boolean indicating if the item is an ingredient or not.
      desc - The description of the item.

    • loadVmArray

      public ArrayList<VendingMachine> loadVmArray(ArrayList<VendingMachine> vmListArray)
      Loads vending machine data from the vmList file and populates an ArrayList of VendingMachine objects. The method reads vending machine data from the vmList file and converts each line of data into VendingMachine objects or SpecialVendingMachine objects based on the type of the vending machine (regular or special). It populates an ArrayList of VendingMachine objects and returns it. If any parsing or file reading errors occur, appropriate exception handling is done.
      Parameters:
      vmListArray - An ArrayList of VendingMachine objects to be populated with data from the vmList file.
      Returns:
      An updated ArrayList of VendingMachine objects containing the loaded vending machine data.

    • loadItemsToVendingMachine

      public HashMap<Item,Integer> loadItemsToVendingMachine(int vmID, String vmName)
      Loads item data from the specified vending machine file and populates a HashMap of items and quantities. The method reads item data from the specified vending machine file and converts each line of data into Item objects. It then populates a HashMap with the Item objects as keys and the corresponding quantities as values. The method takes the vending machine ID and name as input to locate the appropriate vending machine file. If any parsing or file reading errors occur, appropriate exception handling is done.
      Parameters:
      vmID - The ID of the vending machine from which to load items.
      vmName - The name of the vending machine from which to load items.
      Returns:
      A HashMap containing the loaded items as keys and their corresponding quantities as values.
